oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Numerical Methods for Finding Stationary Gravitational Solutions
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dias, Oscar J. C.
Santos, Jorge E.
Way, Benson
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: High Energy Physics - Theory
General Relativity and Quantum Cosmology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The wide applications of higher dimensional gravity and gauge/gravity duality have fuelled the search for new stationary solutions of the Einstein equation (possibly coupled to matter). In this topical review, we explain the mathematical foundations and give a practical guide for the numerical solution of gravitational boundary value problems. We present these methods by way of example: resolving asymptotically flat black rings, singly-spinning lumpy black holes in anti-de Sitter (AdS), and the Gregory-Laflamme zero modes of small rotating black holes in AdS$_5\times S^5$. We also include several tools and tricks that have been useful throughout the literature.
Comment: Invited Topical Review for Classical and Quantum Gravity, 153 pages, 11 figures
